DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Laparoscopy Rectal Excision Surgical Stapler Medical Device Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the numeric count of surgical staples, mechanical fasteners of tissues (e.g., closing of wounds, joining organs, bone fixation) following removal of a portion of the rectum as part of the laparoscopic surgical procedure, creating a small incision through which laparoscopic instruments can be used for examination or excision within the abdominal cavity.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Laparoscopy Rectal Excision Surgical Stapler Medical Device
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical device designed for mechanical fastening of tissues (e.g., closing of wounds, joining organs, bone fixation) by delivering staples into the tissues following removal of a portion of the rectum as part of the laparoscopic surgical procedure, creating a small incision through which laparoscopic instruments can be used for examination or excision within the abdominal cavity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredName: Laparoscopy Rectal Excision Surgical Stapler Medical Device
Property.preferredDefinition: (lap-a-RAHS-ko-pee) The insertion of a thin, lighted tube (called a laparoscope) through the abdominal wall to inspect the inside of the abdomen and remove tissue samples.:Rectal; of, or pertaining to, the rectum.:Removal or excision by surgical measures.:A medical instrument designed for mechanical fastening of soft tissues (e.g., closing of incisions or wounds) by delivering staples into the tissues. These devices usually consist of a mechanism for delivering staples and a disposable cartridge containing the staples.:Medical device - any machinery designed to aid diagnostic and medical therapies. Medical device has to be designed with rigorous safety standards. There are several basic types of medical devices: life support equipment used to maintain a patient's body functions; therapeutic equipment; monitors and detectors to measure the indexes of a patient's state; imagine machines and laboratory equipment used with diagnostic and status monitoring purposes. In insurance parlance, the term is usually synonymous with assistive device, although it may include medical supplies.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure during which a laparoscope is inserted into the abdomen to view the abdominopelvic contents for diagnostic and/or therapeutic purposes.
Of or pertaining to the rectum.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

A medical instrument designed for mechanical fastening of soft tissues (e.g., closing of incisions or wounds) by delivering staples into the tissues. These devices usually consist of a mechanism for delivering staples and a disposable cartridge containing the staples.
Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.
